title: Quick Test 04: Prepositions (Location)
description: Quick practice for two-way prepositions (Wechselpräpositionen) with location vs. motion

questions.explanationDetail: Two-way prepositions use Dativ for location (wo?). Das Buch liegt auf dem Tisch (the book is lying on the table). Lying = location, not motion. Use Dativ.

questions.text: Ich lege das Buch auf ___ Tisch.
questions.explanationDetail: Two-way prepositions use Akkusativ for motion (wohin?). Ich lege das Buch auf den Tisch (I put the book on the table). Putting = motion. Use Akkusativ.
Sitting = location (wo?). Use Dativ with 'in'. Die Katze sitzt in dem Garten (the cat is sitting in the garden). Location uses Dativ.
Going = motion (wohin?). Use Akkusativ with 'in'. Die Katze geht in den Garten (the cat goes into the garden). Motion uses Akkusativ.
Hanging (location) = wo?. Use Dativ with 'an'. Das Bild hängt an der Wand (the picture hangs on the wall). Feminine Dativ: der.

questions.text: Ich hänge das Bild an ___ Wand.
questions.explanationDetail: Hanging (action) = wohin?. Use Akkusativ with 'an'. Ich hänge das Bild an die Wand (I hang the picture on the wall). Feminine Akkusativ: die.
Standing = location (wo?). Use Dativ with 'vor'. Wir stehen vor dem Haus (we're standing in front of the house). Neuter Dativ: dem.
Going = motion (wohin?). Use Akkusativ with 'vor'. Wir gehen vor das Haus (we're going in front of the house). Neuter Akkusativ: das.
